column2: LOUISIANA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Louisiana
column6: LA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white

column2: 2. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column10: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles

column2: 4. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Curve ahead
column6: Merging Traffic

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Warning
column6: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 7. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: change lanes.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 8. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column6: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.

column2: 9. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column6: to the right of the road
column8: to the left of the road

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Yield right-of-way
column6: Lane shifting
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 11. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column6: Round

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column6: Right turns not allowed.

column2: 13. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left lane.
column6: the lane you’re in.
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 14. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 15. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Turn right or go through
column6: Side Road

column2: 17. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: stop immediately.
column6: yield to other pedestrians.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 18. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: try to pass close behind.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 19. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 20. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: switch to daytime lights.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 21. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 22. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: Rounabout rules apply.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column10: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 23. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: round.
column6: diamond shaped.

column2: 24. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 25. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column6: signal and change lanes.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column10: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 26. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 27. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 28. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require more space for turning movements.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 29. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 30. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over your left shoulder.
column6: look over your right shoulder.
column8: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column6: All traffic turn right

column2: 32. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: if it’s raining.
column6: AFTER you move.
column10: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 33. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 34. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 35. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 36. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: merge to the left.
column6: slow down at the traffic signal.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 37. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: where there is a red light.
column6: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column8: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.

column2: 38. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 39. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column10: look into the left side mirror.

column2: 40. An orange-colored sign means:
column4: Construction zone ahead
column6: Railroad crossing ahead
